TEXT.citation: Early, R. J., & Whitehorn, J. (2003). One hundred Paiwan texts. Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University.
TEXT.BibTeX_citation: @book{100paiwantexts, author = {Robert Early and John Whitehorn}, title = {One Hundred Paiwan Texts}, year = {2003}, publisher = {Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University}}

S.FORM: izua ti Tjukutjuku a pinatsayan nua kama nua kina, aya a milimilingan.
izoa ti Tjokotjoko a pinacayan noa kama noa kina, aya a milimilingan.
S.TRANSL: There was a person called Tjukutjuku whose father and mother had died, according to the old story.

S.FORM: saka izua ti sa Tjamuakakay, saka galemgemi azua ti Tjukutjuku.
saka izoa ti sa Tjamoakakay, saka galemgemi azoa ti Tjokotjoko.
S.TRANSL: There was also a person called Tjamuakakay (or Muakakay, her aunt, OA), who disliked Tjukutjuku.

S.FORM: saka zua vavayan a kakeḍian pułatan tua nanemanemanga tua qinałan tua kadjunangan.
saka zoa vavayan a kakedrian poljatan toa nanemanemanga toa qinaljan toa kadjonangan.
S.TRANSL: The young girl had no inheritance of village or land left.

S.FORM: mangtjez azua tju Makazayazaya ti Pułałułałuyan kati Kułełułełu a kisudju tua zua ti Tjukutjuku.
mangtjez azoa tjo Makazayazaya ti Poljaljoljaljoyan kati Koljeljoljeljo a kisodjo toa zoa ti Tjokotjoko.
S.TRANSL: Pułałułałuyan and Kułełułełu of Makazayazaya came to court Tjukutjuku.

S.FORM: saka zazua ti sa Tjamuakakay patalaq azua.
saka zazoa ti sa Tjamoakakay patalaq azoa.
S.TRANSL: So Tjamuakakay was jealous.

S.FORM: "aku nu kisudjuan zazua namaya?" ayain azua tia Pułałułałuyan kati Kułełułełu.
"ako no kisodjoan zazoa namaya?" ayain azoa tia Poljaljoljaljoyan kati Koljeljoljeljo.
S.TRANSL: “Why do you court someone like that?” she said to Pułałułałuyan and Kułełułełu.

S.FORM: azua ti Tjukutjuku tjenglayen nua zua maḍusa.
azoa ti Tjokotjoko tjenglayen noa zoa madrosa.
S.TRANSL: But these two liked Tjukutjuku.

S.FORM: vaik azua sema vavua mazelizeliuł.
vaik azoa sema vavoa mazelizeliolj.
S.TRANSL: They all went to the fields and worked together.

S.FORM: ka nadjemałun i vavua, "aku nu kizeliułan a namaya? savaqar tua kaḍaḍi tua nakuyan.
ka nadjemaljon i vavoa, "ako no kizelioljan a namaya? savaqar toa kadradri toa nakoyan.
S.TRANSL: When she got to the fields, (she said): “Why do you help someone like that with her work? She’s disgusting in her rags and ugliness.

S.FORM: sa-u tsikelu," ayain ni sa Tjamuakakay a maḍusa.
sa-o cikelo," ayain ni sa Tjamoakakay a madrosa.
S.TRANSL: Go off home,” Tjamuakakay said to the two men.

S.FORM: manu ini kilangda azazua a matjelu.
mano ini kilangda azazoa a matjelo.
S.TRANSL: But the three of them didn’t listen to her.

S.FORM: seman quma tua vasa, saka sema tapaw zazua kentsengeł.
seman qoma toa vasa, saka sema tapaw zazoa kencengelj.
S.TRANSL: They made a field of taro, and then went to the hut for lunch.

S.FORM: ka keman azua, "maya kidadut tua maḍusa; sasequ sun savaqar," ayain ni sa Tjamuakakay ti Tjukutjuku.
ka keman azoa, "maya kidadot toa madrosa; saseqo son savaqar," ayain ni sa Tjamoakakay ti Tjokotjoko.
S.TRANSL: When they were eating, Tjamuakakay said to Tjukutjuku: “Don’t go near those two. You smell and are disgusting.”

S.FORM: sa patjadaan ni sa Tjamuakakay azua ti Tjukutjuku.
sa patjadaan ni sa Tjamoakakay azoa ti Tjokotjoko.
S.TRANSL: Tjamuakakay shared out food for Tjukutjuku;

S.FORM: saka nu patjada, sinu kakeḍian ni Tjukutjuku; avan a ni sa Tjamuakakay qatsaqatsan.
saka no patjada, sino kakedrian ni Tjokotjoko; avan a ni sa Tjamoakakay qacaqacan.
S.TRANSL: and when she did so the bits for Tjukutjuku were all small, and it was Tjamuakakay’s that were the big ones.

S.FORM: manu saka keman azua, sema zua i tjai Tjukutjuku.
mano saka keman azoa, sema zoa i tjai Tjokotjoko.
S.TRANSL: But when the two men ate they came to Tjukutjuku.

S.FORM: sa ka makakan, vaik a sema kavavuan.
sa ka makakan, vaik a sema kavavoan.
S.TRANSL: When they had finished eating, they went back to the fields.

S.FORM: saka seleman anga a sema tapaw.
saka seleman anga a sema tapaw.
S.TRANSL: When it was getting dark they came to the hut.

S.FORM: ka uri vaik azua, "kasiułayu," ayain ti Tjukutjuku ni sa Tjamuakakay.
ka ori vaik azoa, "kasioljayo," ayain ti Tjokotjoko ni sa Tjamoakakay.
S.TRANSL: When they were going to go, Tjamuakakay said to Tjukutjuku; “Stay here!”

S.FORM: inika ui ti Tjukutjuku.
inika oi ti Tjokotjoko.
S.TRANSL: Tjukutjuku wouldn’t agree.

S.FORM: i vavaw tua tapaw a kalutskuts.
i vavaw toa tapaw a kalockoc.
S.TRANSL: Tjamuakakay got on the hut and shouted.

S.FORM: "ari," ayain azua maḍusa.
"ari," ayain azoa madrosa.
S.TRANSL: “Let’s go!” she said to the two men.

S.FORM: manu qemaung sakamaya.
mano qemaong sakamaya.
S.TRANSL: And Tjukutjuku cried.

S.FORM: manu, "ari sakamaya," aya zazua maḍusa, ayain ti Tjukutjuku.
mano, "ari sakamaya," aya zazoa madrosa, ayain ti Tjokotjoko.
S.TRANSL: So those two said to Tjukutjuku: “Come on, let’s go.”

S.FORM: inika ui angata.
inika oi angata.
S.TRANSL: But she refused.

S.FORM: vaikan a sema umaq masalasaladj.
vaikan a sema omaq masalasaladj.
S.TRANSL: So they left her and went off home together.

S.FORM: manu kemłang anga azua vuvu a sitsuayan a namatsay anga.
mano kemljang anga azoa vovo a sicoayan a namacay anga.
S.TRANSL: Now Tjukutjuku’s grandparent (grandfather, OA), who was long since dead, knew about it all.

S.FORM: mangtjez azua ti sa vuluvulung a venatsaq tua lukuł.
mangtjez azoa ti sa volovolong a venacaq toa lokolj.
S.TRANSL: And this old person came, carrying a box on a pole.

S.FORM: izua anemanemanga sipavay tjai Tjukutjuku, tua zangaq tua kałat tua situngan.
izoa anemanemanga sipavay tjai Tjokotjoko, toa zangaq toa kaljat toa sitongan.
S.TRANSL: Tjukutjuku was given all kinds of things-necklaces, bracelets and clothes.

S.FORM: "veritsan anga a su kava; nasa sakuya," ayain ni sa vuluvulung.
"verican anga a so kava; nasa sakoya," ayain ni sa volovolong.
S.TRANSL: “Throw away your clothes; they seem nasty,” said the old person.

S.FORM: sa kipavalit anga azua ti Tjukutjuku.
sa kipavalit anga azoa ti Tjokotjoko.
S.TRANSL: So Tjukutjuku changed her clothes.

S.FORM: saka "uri vaik aken," aya azua vuluvulung.
saka "ori vaik aken," aya azoa volovolong.
S.TRANSL: “I’m going,” said the old person.

S.FORM: "kitsiur aken," aya zua ti Tjukutjuku.
"kicior aken," aya zoa ti Tjokotjoko.
S.TRANSL: “I’ll come with you,” said Tjukutjuku.

S.FORM: manu "maya.
mano "maya.
S.TRANSL: “Don’t!

S.FORM: aku kitsiur sun? ła namatsay anga ken a sitsuayan," aya, saka inika ui.
ako kicior son? lja namacay anga ken a sicoayan," aya, saka inika oi.
S.TRANSL: Why would you go with me? I’ve been dead a long time,” said the old person, who wouldn’t agree,

S.FORM: sa zua vaik anga sakamaya azua vuluvulung.
sa zoa vaik anga sakamaya azoa volovolong.
S.TRANSL: and just went off.

S.FORM: manu małianga zazua mangtjez anga kasi umaq azazua matjelu.
mano maljianga zazoa mangtjez anga kasi omaq azazoa matjelo.
S.TRANSL: Next day the other three came from home.

S.FORM: saka nakemavanga nazemangaq anga nakemałat anga.
saka nakemavanga nazemangaq anga nakemaljat anga.
S.TRANSL: Tjukutjuku was wearing the new clothes, necklaces and bracelets.

S.FORM: saka "uki kasinu sa tsinakaw ni tsaqi," aya azua ti sa Tjamuakakay.
saka "oki kasino sa cinakaw ni caqi," aya azoa ti sa Tjamoakakay.
S.TRANSL: “So where has the stinker stolen those?” said Tjamuakakay.

S.FORM: "ni vuvu a sinipavay taqezemetj.
"ni vovo a sinipavay taqezemetj.
S.TRANSL: “The grandparent gave them to me last night,

S.FORM: 'kemłang aken tu kinagalemgeman sun nia tjaina.
'kemljang aken to kinagalemgeman son nia tjaina.
S.TRANSL: and said: ‘I know your aunt dislikes you.

S.FORM: (nu) tsemikel anga sun a sema umaq, qaqivu anga tua vali tua semuap tu su umaq,' ayain ni vuvu," aya ti Tjukutjuku.
(no) cemikel anga son a sema omaq, qaqivo anga toa vali toa semoap to so omaq,' ayain ni vovo," aya ti Tjokotjoko.
S.TRANSL: When you go home, tell the wind to sweep your house,’ said the grandparent,” said Tjukutjuku.

S.FORM: manu uri vaik anga azua.
mano ori vaik anga azoa.
S.TRANSL: When they were going to leave,

S.FORM: "vatsaqu azua ku nanemanemanga," aya ti Tjukutjuku tua zua maḍusa.
"vacaqo azoa ko nanemanemanga," aya ti Tjokotjoko toa zoa madrosa.
S.TRANSL: Tjukutjuku said to the two men: “Carry my things.”

S.FORM: manu "maya," ayain ni Tjamuakakay azua maḍusa.
mano "maya," ayain ni Tjamoakakay azoa madrosa.
S.TRANSL: “Don’t!” said Tjamuakakay to the two.

S.FORM: manu "vatsaqu sakamaya.
mano "vacaqo sakamaya.
S.TRANSL: “Just carry them.

S.FORM: inika ku tsinakaw; sinipavay ni vuvu," aya azua ti Tjukutjuku.
inika ko cinakaw; sinipavay ni vovo," aya azoa ti Tjokotjoko.
S.TRANSL: I didn’t steal them. The grandparent gave them to me,” said Tjukutjuku.

S.FORM: sa vatsaqi anga nazua maḍusa a djemałun i umaq.
sa vacaqi anga nazoa madrosa a djemaljon i omaq.
S.TRANSL: So the two carried them back to the house.

S.FORM: pasa qaqivuin a vali, sa suapi a umaq ni Tjukutjuku, sa pasa qumaqani anga azua nanemanemanga.
pasa qaqivoin a vali, sa soapi a omaq ni Tjokotjoko, sa pasa qomaqani anga azoa nanemanemanga.
S.TRANSL: She tried giving orders to the wind, and it swept Tjukutjuku’s house, and she put all her things into the house.

S.FORM: sa pasa puzayazayai a załum a ḍiḍi.
sa pasa pozayazayai a zaljom a dridri.
S.TRANSL: And she put water and the pigs into the inner part.

S.FORM: sa kavaruk a "makułi a załum," aya zazua.
sa kavarok a "makolji a zaljom," aya zazoa.
S.TRANSL: And she swore: “The water has run dry.”

S.FORM: makułi a załum, saka nekanga nu sikesa, nu tekelen.
makolji a zaljom, saka nekanga no sikesa, no tekelen.
S.TRANSL: The water ran dry, and there was none to cook with or to drink.

S.FORM: manu matsay anga a kakeḍian a ramałemałeng.
mano macay anga a kakedrian a ramaljemaljeng.
S.TRANSL: So children and old people died.

S.FORM: manu kiqaung anga sikataqałan.
mano kiqaong anga sikataqaljan.
S.TRANSL: When the villagers asked,

S.FORM: mangtjez azua vuluvulung.
mangtjez azoa volovolong.
S.TRANSL: the old person came,

S.FORM: "pavayi aken tua załum.
"pavayi aken toa zaljom.
S.TRANSL: and said: “Give me some water.

S.FORM: idan a su tjakumuł."
idan a so tjakomolj."
S.TRANSL: Give me your blanket.

S.FORM: sa tjevengi ni Tjukutjuku, sa pavayan anga tazua vuluvulung.
sa tjevengi ni Tjokotjoko, sa pavayan anga tazoa volovolong.
S.TRANSL: And Tjukutjuku wetted it, and gave it to the old person.

S.FORM: manu maqepu a qaliqali a teptepan.
mano maqepo a qaliqali a teptepan.
S.TRANSL: Then others gathered round and sucked it.

S.FORM: saka megarang ti Tjukutjuku.
saka megarang ti Tjokotjoko.
S.TRANSL: Tjukutjuku got annoyed.

S.FORM: "tsuqitsuqi," aya tua sikataqałan.
"coqicoqi," aya toa sikataqaljan.
S.TRANSL: “That’s enough,” she said to the villagers.

S.FORM: manu "nia patsevudi tua załum a su qinałan," aya.
mano "nia pacevodi toa zaljom a so qinaljan," aya.
S.TRANSL: “We’ll give your village a source of water.”

S.FORM: tsevud anga a załum; sa mirazek anga a qinałan, aya a
cevod anga a zaljom; sa mirazek anga a qinaljan, aya a
S.TRANSL: tjautsikel.
